title: Can't upgrade firefox to newer version on ubuntu laptop
content:
I'm running Firefox browser 88.0 (64) bit, and have been trying since before Xmas to upgrade it to a newer version. It's installed on an older Dell laptop running Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (which I've also tried repeatedly to upgrade without success).

I've tried to upgrade both through the UI, but also tried using the command line in Terminal. Per advice in other threads, I've found the best mirror site and changed my settings to use that, but still no luck. Even the preliminary "sudo apt update" via Terminal fails; the first error tells me that the public key is not available. I assume that's the place to start, but don't know how to correct it.

I'm up against the deadline for updating my browser, and would very much appreciate any help you can provide. (Please note that I'm posting from a newer computer, so automatically generated info about my system won't apply. See the screenshots for that info).

title: phonepe wrong transaction refund amount
content: Contact PhonePe customer support If the payment is still pending after 48 hours, you can contact PhonePe customer support at 07718-281540. Escalate with banking authorities PhonePe can escalate the issue with the banking authorities on your behalf. Contact the receiver's bank If the payment is still not received after 5 days, you can contact the receiver's bank with the UTR number. Here are some reasons why a PhonePe transaction might be pending: Bank processing delays: The bank might be experiencing delays. Technical issues: In rare cases, technical issues might cause a payment to take longer than usual. While the payment is pending, your money is safe with the bank. If the payment is successful, the money will be deposited into the receiver's account. If the payment fails, the money will be refunded to your account within 3 to 5 days.

title: MS Defender Firewall Block
content:
Been using Netscape then Mozilla load since 1996. Jan 13 2025 I turned on computer (for 3rd time) and (all browsers) Mozilla is blocked by windows defender firewall. Jan 14th I turned on PC and same.

Setting\windows defender firewall setting is now in perpetual circle of processing request.

  • Windows Smart App Contol is turned off.
  • advance virus scan will not launch due to alpha characters will not populate, only numeric, even when switching keyboard languages.
  • quick and full scan work with no errors, prior successful was Jan 10th , 10 min before turning off computer (quick)
  • no error or alarms other than "firewall is blocking Mozilla & Mozilla VPN". MS Edge Browser just sits with no pages loaded, no error messages.
  • NIC and internet is working fine as ping and othe CMD to international work. Email clients work.
  • Client ( L&T TS) Microsoft Intune installed for work Account

Windows 11 pro, all updates to windows and Mozilla, virus and dell processed through January 10 (from history)

title: Only part of Oddschecker (the first race on each day) is available for Cheltenham Festival
content:
The biggest race meeting of the year, the Cheltenham Festival, is approaching (March 11-14). On oddschecker, used by all racing enthusiasts, when you go to the ante post section and click on Cheltenham Festival which they split up by putting Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday and Friday and all the races on that day are available. However, when you click on any of the days, all that comes up is the first race. I contacted Oddschecker, thinking that this was there problem. They came back to me saying they could not find a fault and I should try another browser. On trying Google Chrome I found that all the races were available in the Cheltenham Festival Section. It would seem then that the problem is with Firefox. Could you look into this for me or I, and other racing followers are going to have to swap Browsers as information of the races on the 4 most important days of the year (jumps section) is unavailable through Firefox. This has been discussed at length on the forum. Can you try and fix it please as Firefox is my main browser.

Graham Clark ( for theracingforum.co.uk )

https://www.oddschecker.com/cheltenham-festival

title: No access to a few bank sites
content:
I get this message on 2 bank sites I frequently use:

Access Denied

You are unauthorized to access this resource.

Reference ID is: 3bc60f9794

Troubleshooting Steps

1. Reload the home page and try again.

2. Clear your browser cache and try again.

3. Try logging in with a different browser.

4. Try logging in with a different device. I have gone through all of the above steps. I can access these sites on Chrome. title: Why does Firefox crash when accessing a specific YouTube playlist?
content:
Hi,

I’ve encountered a puzzling issue that has left me scratching my head. Every time I open a specific YouTube playlist on Firefox while using Mozilla VPN, my browser crashes within seconds. The crash happens only on this playlist, and oddly, it doesn’t occur when:

The VPN is turned off. I use other browsers (Chrome, Edge). I play the videos individually, outside the playlist.

The playlist in question is embedded on a page I’ve built for testing video playlists on my website (you can see it here: https://themagistv.pro/. The crashes happen when I try to preview the playlist directly from the site using Firefox.

I’ve already tried:

Changing Mozilla VPN server locations. Clearing the Firefox cache and cookies. Disabling all extensions and testing in Safe Mode. Checking for crashes in about:crashes (no detailed report appears).

I suspect the crash might involve a unique interaction between Firefox’s video rendering engine and Mozilla VPN’s traffic routing for playlists. Could this be a conflict with HLS streaming, or perhaps Firefox’s handling of encrypted traffic for consecutive video loading?

This issue has persisted across two different systems (Windows 11 and macOS Ventura). Has anyone encountered something similar, or are there debugging steps I can take to pinpoint the root cause?

Thank you for any insights
creator: themagistv.pro

title: Site not loading: "Unable to contact server..."
content:
Da circa una settimana mi capita in maniera abbastanza casuale che alcuni siti non si caricano subito, ma mi viene riposrtato il seguente errore: " Uhm… non riusciamo a trovare questo sito.

Impossibile contattare il server download.zotero.org.

Se hai inserito l’indirizzo corretto, puoi: 

   Riprovare più tardi    Verificare la connessione alla rete    Controllare che Firefox abbia il permesso di accedere a Internet (la connessione potrebbe essere protetta da un firewall)"

Se clicco in alto a sinistra nella barra dell'indirizzo, dove c'è una "i" trovo scritto "Errore di connessione" e cliccando su questo avviso mi dice: "La connessione su questo sito non è sicura. La connessione con questo sito non è privata...". Se clicco su ulteriori dettagli nella scheda di sicurezza riguardante le informazioni della pagina si dice: "Connessione non crittata. Il sito non supporta la crittazione per la pagina visualizzata".

Se provo a ricaricare la pagina, dopo alcuni tentativi la pagina viene caricata.

Preciso che mi trovo su una rete ethernet aziendale e che con altro browser non riscontro il problema.

Cosa posso provare?

title: Bug Report: document.referrer Not Working Consistently in Firefox
content:
Hi,

We are encountering an issue with how document.referrer behaves in Firefox. In our application, we track the source of traffic using document.referrer. While this functionality works consistently in Safari and Chrome, it does not produce the expected results in Firefox most of the time. For comparison: 

   In Safari and Chrome, document.referrer reliably provides the referring URL, as expected.    In Firefox, the value is often empty or incorrect, leading to inconsistent tracking results.

I’ve attached a screenshot that demonstrates the issue for your reference.

Issue Details with Screenshots: 

   Direct URL Open (Expected Behavior)    In the first screenshot, we directly open the URL. As expected, document.referrer is empty because there is no referrer when the URL is opened directly. 
   Screenshot 1: https://app.screencast.com/hgdoASFVXaozl 
   Clicking a Link (Unexpected Behavior)    In the second screenshot, we click on a link from within our site. When we check document.referrer in the file, it still shows as empty, which is incorrect. The referrer should reflect the URL of the linking page. 
   Screenshot 2: https://app.screencast.com/CzJZLBUJET9XQ

This discrepancy is impacting our ability to accurately track traffic sources.

Additional Note:

I intended to report this issue on Bugzilla, but I have not received the account verification email despite waiting for 3-4 days. Without access to my Bugzilla account, I’m submitting the issue here instead.

Please let me know if you need further clarification or additional examples.

This discrepancy is impacting our ability to accurately track traffic sources. We believe there might be a bug causing this behavior and would appreciate it if your team could investigate.

Thank you for your support and looking forward to your feedback!
creator: irontestteam

title: Firefox keeps crashing after update
content:
Hello everyone, Firefox seems restarting lately after update of various extensions and plugins.

It all started after I updated some extensions. I don't know why, it keeps repeating itself (probably already a dozen times, didn't count them but it happens very often). Firefox crashes, the bug report window appears shortly after, I try to send the report, but it says error, by clicking on "Details" the text I posted in the Troubleshoot Information appears, but I don't know where to look at to solve it, obviously.

I tried clearing cache, disabling updates for extensions, switching to default theme and other workarounds from similar threads I've found... like scanning the PC or memory for spywares, etc. no threats were found, even the least dangerous ones (shown in green with minimum level of risk, like cookies) were fixed but firefox keeps restarting as describing. I've also changed some configuration in about:config as stated in similar topics but I can't remember which ones, they just didn't work.

Further info: Firefox version 128.6.0 esr (32 bit) Windows 10 (64bit) HP Intel i5 PC 8 GB RAM Integrated video card

The problem seems occurring more often when I'm typing or when I click into text boxes, but it also happens randomly when I leave firefox in the background. I'm honestly clueless.


Thank you in advance for any help
creator: emanuelepepi86

title: Need to update Firefox to version 115 ESR 32-bit on Windows 7, but it says it's already up to date.
content: My desktop PC is Windows 7 32-bit with Firefox version 84 = old version. But in Firefox "About Firefox" it says "Firefox is up to date with version 84. Still says version 84 Firefox is "up to date". My sister used to handle software on this PC but she died and I'm just getting to this between estate paperwork. Apologize for the last minute request. Is there some other setting that could stop an update? Should I close all Firefox windows and re-open them? I found a "download ESR 32-bit" button on a Mozilla help article page, but it wanted me to decide where to save and .exe file and I wasn't sure if that determines where the program would go or if it would be a new installation and lose the existing setting.
